function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Comparing noise levels before and during lockdown may indicate changes in behavior and activity, impacting disease spread","Impact":"Failure to understand noise-related behavior changes may lead to inadequate disease mitigation strategies","Mitigation":"Conduct a thorough analysis of behavior changes during the lockdown period to inform disease mitigation strategies","Technologies":"Behavior monitoring technology, epidemiological data analysis tools","People":"Public, epidemiologists, public health officials","Owner":"Epidemiologists, public health officials"},{"Description":"Annoyance caused by noise pollution may lead to stress and weakened immune systems, increasing susceptibility to contagious diseases","Impact":"Higher levels of annoyance may lead to compromised immune systems, increasing the risk of contagious disease transmission","Mitigation":"Implement noise reduction measures and stress management programs to minimize the impact of noise pollution on health","Technologies":"Noise reduction technology, stress monitoring and management tools","People":"General public, individuals living in noisy environments","Owner":"Urban planners, community health organizations"},{"Description":"Conversion of annoyance ratings to percentage of highly annoyed may oversimplify the impact of noise on mental and physical health","Impact":"Oversimplification may lead to inadequate understanding of the health risks associated with noise pollution","Mitigation":"Conduct a comprehensive health impact assessment of noise pollution using multidisciplinary approaches","Technologies":"Health impact assessment tools, data analytics platforms","People":"Health researchers, public health agencies","Owner":"Health research institutions, public health agencies"}]}
